# zNear

**Instance Property**

The camera’s near depth limit. Animatable.

## Declaration

```swift
var zNear: Double { get set }
```

## Discussion

The near value determines the minimal distance between the camera and a visible surface. If a surface is closer to the camera than this  distance, the surface is clipped and does not appear. The near value must not be zero. The default near value is `1.0`.

You can animate changes to this property’s value. See [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/animating-scenekit-content].

## Adjusting Camera Perspective

- **zFar**: The camera’s far depth limit. Animatable.
- **automaticallyAdjustsZRange**: A Boolean value that determines whether the camera automatically adjusts its [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNCamera/zNear] and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNCamera/zFar] depth limits.
